com.percussion.integration
Class PSSearch

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.integration.PSSearch

public class PSSearch
extends Object

This class is used for searches. I can behave as both the input to a search as well as the output from a search. With the help of the PSItem and PSField classes, it can take the form of the following: INPUT - create a new PSItem with query fields and optionally result fields to return from the search - use the getQuerySearchFields method to return only the fields necessary for creating the where clause of the search - use the getQueryResultFields method to return only the fields that are used for the select statement of the search OUTPUT from search - use the getItems method to return all the items from the search as a list of PSItems - with each PSItem you can retrieve all the fields requested within the search as well as the default ones

Constructor Detail

PSSearch

public PSSearch()
Default constructor for creating a new search for either INPUT or OUTPUT. Sets the list of items to an empty list.

Method Detail

addItem

public void addItem(PSItem item)
For INPUT, adding an item is used to create new search criteria or for adding new result fields to be included in the search. For OUTPUT, adding an item is used to store the results of a search. Each content item is contained within a PSItem object.

Parameters:
item - the item to be added to the search item list, assumed not null

getItems

public List getItems()
For INPUT, returns the items that make up the criteria for the search. For OUTPUT, returns the result items from the search.

Returns:
a list of PSItem objects, will not be null , may be an empty list

getQuerySearchFields

public List getQuerySearchFields()
For INPUT, returns the list of fields that are used for building the WHERE clause for the specified search. For OUTPUT, this method will return an empty list.

Returns:
a list of PSField objects, will not be null , it may be an empty list

getQueryResultFields

public List getQueryResultFields()
For INPUT, returns the list of fields that are used for building the SELECT clause for the specified search. For OUTPUT, this method will return an empty list.

Returns:
a list of PSField objects, will not be null , it may be an empty list

addProperty

public void addProperty(String name,
                        String value)
Add a property to the list of properties.

Parameters:
name - name of the property to add, must never be null
value - value of the property to add, must never be null

getProperties

public Map getProperties()
Accessor for properties for this search.

Returns:
a Map of properties, never null

toHTML

public String toHTML()
Convert this search to it's HTML equivalent. Effectively returns a complete table (TABLE) of this item.

Returns:
an HTML string representing this table, never null or empty

toHTML

public String toHTML(List columnList)
See toHTML(columnList) for details

toHTML

public String toHTML(List columnList,
                     int sortColumn,
                     String oddRowCss,
                     String evenRowCss)
Convert this field to it's HTML equivalent. Effectively returns a complete table (TABLE) of this item. If the columnList parameter is not null or 0 size, we return each field's HTML in the columnList order, otherwise we return all the fields as HTML.

Parameters:
columnList - a list of internal field names as strings, these are to determine the order and visibility of each of the fields within this item, may be null or empty
sortColumn - sort the items in the search results on the specified column. The column must be from 1 to the number of available columns.
oddRowCss - If non-null, apply this style to odd rows
evenRowCss - If non-null, apply this style to even rows
Returns:
an HTML string representing this table, never null or empty

addHTMLAttribute

public void addHTMLAttribute(String attribute)
Adds an attribute to the current set of attributes associated with this search.

Parameters:
attribute - the HTML representation of an attribute, assumed not null or empty, the space separator will be added by this routine automatically

clearHTMLAttributes

public void clearHTMLAttributes()
Clears the current attributes for this search item.
